info.title: Team Chat
info.description: The Team Chat APIs let developers programmatically interact with [Team Chat](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/team-chat-apps/) features. They enable messaging integration into applications and automate workflows within Zoom Team Chat.

get.description:
Returns a list of all the mention groups in a channel. The maximum number of mention groups in a channel is 20.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `chat_channel:read`,`chat_channel:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `team_chat:read:mention_group`,`team_chat:read:mention_group:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `MEDIUM`

parameters.name: channelId
parameters.description: The channel ID.

200.description: The mention group base information.

mention_group_list.description: The information about the mention groups. The maximum number of mention groups in a channel is **20**.

403.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `403`
Forbidden **Error Code:** `200`
No permission to list the mention groups in the channel.
**Error Code:** `200`
Not allowed on a group chat.
**Error Code:** `200`
Not allowed on an archived channel.

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found **Error Code:** `4130`
Channel does not exist: $channelId.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

post.description:
Creates a channel mention group. A channel can have a maximum of 20 mention groups. The caller must be an admin or owner of the channel.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `chat_channel:write`,`chat_channel:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `team_chat:write:mention_group:admin`,`team_chat:write:mention_group`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `MEDIUM`

parameters.name: channelId
parameters.description: The channel ID.

requestBody.description: Creates a mention group in a channel.

identifiers.description:
The user ID or member ID of the member you want to add to the mention group. 
You can add a maximum of 20 users each time. 
It allows `memberId` or `userId`.

201.description: **Status Code**: `201`  Mention group created.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `300`
Invalid parameter: identifiers.
**Error Code:** `200`
Duplicate mention group name
**Error Code:** `5506`
Exceeded the limit of adding mention group. The maximum number of mention group in a channel is 20
**Error Code:** `300`
Invalid parameter: mention_group_name.
**Error Code:** `5301`
Request to create a mention group failed.

403.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `403`
Forbidden **Error Code:** `200`
No permission to create the channel mention group.
**Error Code:** `200`
The user(s) do not have permission to access the channel. {0}
**Error Code:** `200`
Not allowed on a group chat.
**Error Code:** `200`
Not allowed on an archived channel.

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found **Error Code:** `4130`
Channel does not exist: $channelId.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

patch.summary: Update a channel mention group information
patch.description:
Updates a mention group's information. The caller must be the channel's admin or owner.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `chat_channel:write`,`chat_channel:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `team_chat:update:mention_group`,`team_chat:update:mention_group:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `MEDIUM`

parameters.name: channelId
parameters.description: The channel ID.

parameters.name: mentionGroupId
parameters.description: The mention group ID.

requestBody.description: Updates a channel mention group information. Fields whose value is missing or empty string will not be updated.

mention_group_name.description: The mention group's name. If name value is missing or empty string, this field will not be updated.

mention_group_description.description: The mention group's description. If the property is missing, this field will not be updated. If the description is empty string, will remove the previous description.

Bad Request **Error Code:** `200`

Request to update a mention group failed.

No permission to update the mention group info.

Not allowed on a group chat.
**Error Code:** `200`
Not allowed on an archived channel.

get.summary: List the members of a mention group
get.description:
Returns a list of the members in the mention group. The maximum number of members in a mention group is **100**.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `chat_channel:read`,`chat_channel:write:admin`,`chat_channel:read:member`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `team_chat:read:mention_group`,`team_chat:read:mention_group:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: channelId
parameters.description: The channel ID.

parameters.name: mentionGroupId
parameters.description: The mention group ID.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of records returned with a single API call.

200.description: **HTTP Status Code:** `200`   List of channel mention group members.

members.description: The members in a mention group. The maximum number of **members** in a mention group is **100**.

user_id.description: The member's user ID. If the member does not belong to the same account as the current, this field will be empty.

email.description: The member's email address. If the member does not belong to the same account as the current user or is not the current user's contact, this field will be empty.

first_name.description: The member's first name. If the member does not belong to the same account as the current user or is not the current user's contact, this field will be empty.

last_name.description: The member's last name. If the member does not belong to the same account as the current user or is not the current user's contact, this field will be empty.

is_external.description: Whether it is an external member.

next_page_token.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

page_size.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `5301`
Request to list mention group members failed.

403.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `403`
Forbidden **Error Code:** `300`
The next page token is either invalid or has expired.
**Error Code:** `200`
Not allowed on a group chat.
**Error Code:** `200`
Not allowed on an archived channel.
**Error Code:** `200`
No permission to access the channel

**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found **Error Code:** `5508`
The mention group doesn't exist.
**Error Code:** `4130`
Channel does not exist: $channelId.

Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

next_page_token.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

patch.description:
Performs different operations on channels. 

Operations include archive and unarchive. It supports batch operations.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `chat_channel:write:admin`,`chat_channel:write`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `team_chat:update:archive_channels`,`team_chat:update:archive_channels:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

method.description:
The method to perform: 
* `archive` — Archive the channels. 
* `unarchive` — Unarchive the channels.

channel_ids.description: The IDs of channels to be archived or unarchived.

200.description: **Status Code**: `200`   Perform operations on channels returned.

reason.description: The specific reason for the error.

error_code.description:
200:  Unauthorized request. You do not have permission to perform operation on this channel.
3214: Archiving/unarchiving the default channel is not allowed.
3205: This channel has already been archived.
3213: This channel has not been archived.
3215: CMC with recurring meeting can't be archived.
4130: Channel does not exist.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `300`
Invalid parameter.
**Error Code:** `4130`
Channel does not exist.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

get.description:
Returns information about a specific channel.

Zoom chat [channels](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/200912909-Getting-Started-With-Channels-Group-Messaging-) allow users to communicate through chat in private or public groups. 

The [**Get a channel**](/docs/api-reference/chat/methods#operation/getChannel) API retrieves the channel information of other account users.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `chat_channel:read`,`chat_channel:write`,`chat_channel:read:admin`,`chat_channel:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `team_chat:read:channel`,`team_chat:read:channel:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `MEDIUM`

parameters.name: channelId
parameters.description: The channel's unique identifier.

200.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `200`  
 
Channel returned.

add_member_permissions.description:
This field indicates who can add new channel members:  
 * `1` - All channel members can add new members.  
 * `2` - Only channel owners and administrators can add new members.  
 **Note:** Only the channel owner can modify this setting. 
 **Note:** This setting is always set to 1 and not editable for channel types 3, 4 and 5.

new_members_can_see_previous_messages_fi.description: Whether new channel members can view messages and files previously posted in the channel.

posting_permissions.description:
The channel members' posting permissions:  
 * `1` — All chat channel members can post to the channel.  
 * `2` — Only the channel owner and administrators can post to the channel.  
 * `3` — Only the channel owner, administrators and certain members can post to the channel.

mention_all_permissions.description:
This field indicates who can use @all:  
 * `1` - Everyone can use @all.  
 * `2` - Only channel owners and administrators can use @all.  
 * `3` - Nobody can use @all.  
 **Note:** Only the channel owner can modify this setting.

allow_to_add_external_users.description:
Whether external users can be added to the channel:  
 * `0` — External user cannot be added to the channel.  
 * `1` — All chat channel members can add external users to the channel.  
 * `2` — Only members within your organization can add external users to the channel.  
 * `3` - Only channel owners and administrators can add external users to the channel.  
 **Note:** This setting is always set to 1 for channel type 4.

designated_posting_members.description:
The user IDs or member IDs of the channel's member to whom the posting permission was designated. 
 
`posting_permissions` must be `3` to have posting members.

member_id.description: The member id of the designated channel member who has posting permission.

user_id.description: The user ID of the designated channel member who has posting permission. If the member does not belong to the same account as the current, this field will be empty.

items.description: The information of the designated channel member who has posting permission.

jid.description: The [Jabber ID (JID)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JID_(Jabber)) to access the account.

type.description:
The channel's type: 
* `0` — An unknown channel type. 
* `1` — A private channel. Members must be invited to join this channel. 
* `2` — A private channel with members that belong to a Zoom account. All members of this channel are from the same organization and must be invited to join. 
* `3` — A public channel. Anyone can search for and join this channel. 
* `4` — An instant channel. This type of channel is created by adding members to a new chat. 
* `5` — A public channel. Anyone can join this channel and invite members from other Zoom accounts.

channel_url.description: The URL of the Zoom Chat channel.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `200`
Unauthorized request. You do not have permission to access this user's channel information.

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found **Error Code:** `4130`
Channel does not exist: $channelId.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

delete.description:
Deletes a specific channel. Zoom chat [channels](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/200912909-Getting-Started-With-Channels-Group-Messaging-) allow users to communicate via chat in private or public groups. 



**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `chat_channel:write`,`chat_channel:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `team_chat:delete:channel`,`team_chat:delete:channel:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `MEDIUM`

parameters.name: channelId
parameters.description: Channel ID: the channel's unique identifier.

**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `200`
Unauthorized request. You do not have permission to delete this user's channel.

**Error Code:** `5301`
Request to delete a channel failed.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

parameters.name: channelId
parameters.description: The channel ID.

name.description: A new name for the channel.

add_member_permissions.description:
This field indicates who can add new channel members:  
 * `1` - All channel members can add new members.  
 * `2` - Only channel owners and administrators can add new members.  
 **Note:** Only the channel owner can modify this setting.  
 **Note:** This setting is always set to 1 and not editable for channel types 3, 4 and 5.

new_members_can_see_previous_messages_fi.description: Whether new channel members can view messages and files previously posted in the channel.

posting_permissions.description:
The channel members' posting permissions:  
 * `1` — All chat channel members can post to the channel.  
 * `2` — Only channel owners and administrators can post to the channel.  
 * `3` — Only channel owners, administrators, and certain members can post to the channel.

mention_all_permissions.description:
This field indicates who can use @all: 
 * `1` - Everyone can use @all. 
 * `2` - Only channel owners and administrators can use @all. 
 * `3` - Nobody can use @all. 
 **Note:** Only the channel owner can modify this setting.

designated_posting_members.description:
The user IDs or member IDs of the channel's member to whom the posting permission was designated. 
 
You must select `3` for `posting_permissions` in the API request.

items.description: Either the user ID or member ID of the designated channel member who has posting permission.

user_id.description: The user ID.

type.description:
The type of change channel. For example, a change from public channel 5 to private 1, or a change from public 3 to private 2, vice versa, and so on.

The channel's type: 
* `1` — A private channel. Members must be invited to join this channel. 
* `2` — A private channel with members that belong to a Zoom account. All members of this channel are from the same organization and must be invited to join.
* `3` — A public channel. Anyone can search for and join this channel.
* `5` — A public channel. Anyone can join this channel and invite members from other Zoom accounts.

Bad Request **Error Code:** `300`

**Error Code:** `5301`
Request to update a channel failed.

**HTTP Status Code:** `403`
Forbidden **Error Code:** `200`

get.description:
Generates a list of user's chat channels. For user-level apps, pass [the `me` value](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis#mekeyword) instead of the `userId` parameter.Zoom chat [channels](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/200912909-Getting-Started-With-Channels-Group-Messaging-) allow users to communicate through chat in private or public groups.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `chat_channel:read`,`chat_channel:write`,`chat_channel:read:admin`,`chat_channel:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `team_chat:read:list_user_channels`,`team_chat:read:list_user_channels:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `MEDIUM`

parameters.description: The user's unique identifier.

parameters.description: The number of records returned from a single API call.

parameters.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

200.description:
**Status Code**: `200`   
 
User's channels returned.

channels.description: The information about the chat channels.

add_member_permissions.description:
This field indicates who can add new channel members:  
 * `1` - All channel members can add new members.  
 * `2` - Only channel owners and administrators can add new members.  
 **Note:** Only the channel owner can modify this setting.  
 **Note:** This setting is always set to 1 and not editable for channel types 3, 4 and 5.

new_members_can_see_previous_messages_fi.description: Whether new channel members can view messages and files previously posted in the channel.

posting_permissions.description:
The channel members' posting permissions:  
 * `1` — All chat channel members can post to the channel.  
 * `2` — Only channel owners and administrators can post to the channel.  
 * `3` — Only the channel owner, administrators, and certain members can post to the channel.

mention_all_permissions.description:
This field indicates who can use @all:  
 * `1` - Everyone can use @all.  
 * `2` - Only channel owners and administrators can use @all.  
 * `3` - Nobody can use @all.  
 **Note:** Only the channel owner can modify this setting.

allow_to_add_external_users.description:
Whether external users can be added to the channel:  
 * `0` — External user cannot be added to the channel.  
 * `1` — All chat channel members can add external users to the channel.  
 * `2` — Only members within your organization can add external users to the channel.  
 * `3` - Only channel owners and administrators can add external users to the channel.  
 **Note:** This setting is always set to 1 for channel type 4.

jid.description: The [Jabber ID (JID)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JID_(Jabber)) to access the account.

type.description:
The channel's type: 
* `0` — An unknown channel type. 
* `1` — A private channel. Members must be invited to join this channel. 
* `2` — A private channel with members that belong to a Zoom account. All members of this channel are from the same organization and must be invited to join. 
* `3` — A public channel. Anyone can search for and join this channel. 
* `4` — An instant channel. Adding members to a new chat creates this type of channel. 
* `5` — A public channel. Anyone can join this channel and invite members from other Zoom accounts.

channel_url.description: The URL of the Zoom Chat channel.

next_page_token.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token is returned when the available results exceed the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

page_size.description: The number of records returned per page in a single API call.

total_records.description: The total number of records found.

The next page token is either invalid or has expired.

**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

Creates a channel for a user. 

For user-level apps, pass [the `me` value](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis#mekeyword) instead of the `userId` parameter. Zoom chat channels allow users to communicate through chat in private or public groups.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `chat_channel:write`,`chat_channel:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `team_chat:write:user_channel`,`team_chat:write:user_channel:admin`

 **Note:** Only the channel owner can modify this setting. 
 **Note:** This setting is always set to 1 and is not editable for channel types 3, 4 and 5.

members.description: The member(s) to include in the channel. You can add a maximum of 20 members to the channel at once with this API.

type.description:
The type of the channel. 

The value can be one of the following:
 `1`: Private channel. In this type of channel, members must be invited to join a channel. 
 `2`: Private channel with members that belong to one Zoom account. Members in this channel should be invited and the members should be from the same organization. 
 `3`: Public channel. Anyone can search for this channel and join the channel. 
 `4`: Group chat. This is an instant channel you create by adding members to a new chat.

space_channel_type.description:
The shared space channel type.
* `private` - Only invited members can be added. Members do not have to join the shared space.
* `public_for_members` - Everyone in the shared ppace can join.

`1`: Private channel. In this type of channel, members must be invited to join a channel. 
 
`2`: Private channel with members that belong to one Zoom account. Members in this channel should be invited and the members should be from the same organization. 
 
`3`: Public channel. Anyone can search for this channel and join the channel. 
 
`4`: Group chat. This is an instant channel which you can create by adding members to a new chat.

The collection of channels in which search is performed. 

**user_joined** - All channels that the user is a member of, include internal and external channels. When selected, no more than one page of result will be returned. For account-level apps, the user calling this API to search another user joined channels must have a [role](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115001078646-Using-role-management) that has the **View** permission for the **Chat Channels** feature. 

**public** - All account's public channels. 

**all** - All account's channels. The user calling this API to search all account's channels must have a [role](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115001078646-Using-role-management) that has the **View** permission for the **Chat Channels** feature.

type.description:
The channel's type: 
* `0` — An unknown channel type. 
* `1` — A private channel. Members must be invited to join this channel. 
* `2` — A private channel with members that belong to a Zoom account. All members of this channel are from the same organization and must be invited to join. 
* `3` — A public channel. Anyone can search for and join this channel. 
* `4` — An instant channel. Adding members to a new chat creates this type of channel. 
* `5` — A public channel. Anyone can join this channel and invite members from other Zoom accounts.

parameters.description: The channel's unique identifier. The channel type must be 1, 2, 3 or 5. The channel must not be archived.

enable_custom_retention.description: This field enables custom retention policy of the channel. If set to `true`, `retention_period` is required.

retention_period.description:
The custom retention period of the channel. 'y' - year, 'm' - month, 'd' - day. 

- If set by day, accepted range is `1d` through `90d`. 
- If set by month, accepted range is `1m` through `120m`. 
- If set by year, accepted range is `1y` through `10y`.

**HTTP Status Code:** `200`  
 
Channel returned.

add_member_permissions.description:
This field indicates who can add new channel members:  
 * `1` - All channel members can add new members.  
 * `2` - Only channel owners and administrators can add new members.  
 **Note:** Only channel owners can modify this setting.  
 **Note:** This setting is always set to 1 and not editable for channel types 3, 4 and 5.

new_members_can_see_previous_messages_fi.description: Whether new channel members can view messages and files previously posted in the channel.

posting_permissions.description:
The channel members' posting permissions:  
 * `1` — All chat channel members can post to the channel.  
 * `2` — Only channel owners and administrators can post to the channel.  
 * `3` — Only channel owners, administrators, and certain members can post to the channel.

mention_all_permissions.description:
This field indicates who can use @all:  
 * `1` - Everyone can use @all.  
 * `2` - Only channel owners and administrators can use @all.  
 * `3` - Nobody can use @all.  
 **Note:** Only channel owners can modify this setting.

allow_to_add_external_users.description:
Whether external users can be added to the channel:  
 * `0` — External users cannot be added to the channel.  
 * `1` — All chat channel members can add external users to the channel.  
 * `2` — Only members within your organization can add external users to the channel.  
 * `3` - Only channel owners and administrators can add external users to the channel.  
 **Note:** This setting is always set to 1 for channel type 4.

The user IDs or member IDs of the channel's member to whom the posting permission was designated. 
 
`posting_permissions` must be `3` to have posting members.

* `2` — A private channel with members that belong to a Zoom account. All members of this channel are from the same organization and must be invited to join. 
* `3` — A public channel. Anyone can search for and join this channel. 
* `4` — An instant channel. This type of channel is created by adding members to a new chat. 
* `5` — A public channel. Anyone can join this channel and invite members from other Zoom accounts.

Removes multiple members from a user's chat channel in a batch. A [chat channel](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/200912909-Getting-Started-With-Channels-Group-Messaging-) can have one or many members.   
   
 
 

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `chat_channel:write:admin`,`chat_channel:write`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `team_chat:delete:member:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `MEDIUM`

parameters.name: channelId
parameters.description: The channel ID.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user ID of the channel owner or channel admin.

parameters.name: identifiers
parameters.description:
The user ID or member ID of the member you want to remove from the channel. 
You can remove a maximum of 20 agent IDs. 
It allows `memberId` or `userId`.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `200`
No permission to remove channel members.

**Error Code:** `5301`
Unable to remove channel member.

**Error Code:** `300`
You can not remove the current user himself.

**Error Code:** `300`
The maximum number of members that can be removed at a time is 20.
**Error Code:** `403`
Authenticated user has not permitted access to the targeted resource.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

delete.description:
Removes a member from a chat channel. A [channel](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/200912909-Getting-Started-With-Channels-Group-Messaging-) can have one or many members.  For user-level apps, pass [the `me` value](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis#mekeyword) instead of the `userId` parameter.



**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `chat_channel:write`,`chat_channel:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `team_chat:delete:member:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `Medium`

parameters.name: channelId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the channel from where you would like to remove a member. Retrieve this from the [**List user's channels**](/docs/api-reference/chat/methods#operation/getChannels) API.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The email address or user ID or member ID of the member whom you would like to be remove from the channel.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the channel administrator.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `200`
Unauthorized request. You do not have permission to remove channel members on this user's behalf.
**Error Code:** `5301`
Unable to remove channel member.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

post.description:
Add a custom emoji. 

 **Note:** 
* The base URL for this API's is `https://fileapi.zoom.us/v2`. 
* The rate limit of this API is 20 requests per second per API or 2000 requests per second per IP address. 
* The caller must support HTTP 30x redirects. 
* All files are sent as common files except `png`,`jpg`,`jpeg` and `gif` 
* The caller must retain the authorization header when redirected to a different hostname. 
 

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `chat:write`,`chat:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `team_chat:write:custom_emoji`,`team_chat:write:custom_emoji:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

name.description: The name of the emoji to be added. Allowed characters: letters, numbers, underscores. The maximum length is 100.

file.description: The upload file in binary format. You can only send a maximum of 256KB. Only supports jpg, png, gif and jpeg.

201.description: **Status Code:** `201`   Add this custom emoji successfully.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `300`
Invalid parameter, the possible reasons: 1. Allowed characters: letters, numbers, underscores 2. The maximum size of file is 256KB.
**Error Code:** `400`
Invalid file type. Only support jpg,png,gif,jpeg.
**Error Code:** `500`
Add this custom emoji failed.

**HTTP Status Code:** `403`
Forbidden **Error Code:** `40090`
User has no permission to add custom emoji. Contact Zoom Support for details.

409.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `409`
Conflict **Error Code:** `30010`
Duplicate custom emoji name.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

post.description:
Uploads a file to chat. 

 **Note:** 
* The base URL for this API's is `https://file.zoom.us/v2/`. 
* The rate limit of this API is 20 requests per second per API or 2000 requests per second per IP address. 
* The caller must support HTTP 30x redirects. 
* All files are sent as common files except `png`,`jpg`,`jpeg` and `gif` 
* Zoom Cloud Storage will store the files sent through this API. If you do not use Zoom Cloud Storage, Zoom Cloud will temporarily store these files for 7 days. 
* The caller must retain the authorization header when redirected to a different hostname. 
* After upload a file, the default behavior will show the file in personal chat message. 

 For an **account-level** [OAuth app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/guides/getting-started/app-types/create-oauth-app), this API can only be used on behalf of a user who is assigned with a [role](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115001078646-Using-role-management#:~:text=Each%20user%20in%20a%20Zoom,owner%2C%20administrator%2C%20or%20member.&text=Role%2Dbased%20access%20control%20enables,needs%20to%20view%20or%20edit.) that has the **Edit** permission for **Chat Messages**. 

 

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `chat_message:write`,`chat_message:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `team_chat:write:files`,`team_chat:write:files:admin`

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user's ID.

parameters.name: postToPersonalChat
parameters.description: If this field is set to true, the file will be uploaded and posted to personal chat. Or if it is set to false, the file will be uploaded but not posted to personal chat.

file.description: The upload file, in binary format. You can only send a maximum of 1GB files for images and all other file types.

201.description:
**Status Code:** `201`   
 
File successfully uploaded.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `124`
Invalid access token.
**Error Code:** `300`
Maximum file size exceeded: ${maxSize}

**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

post.description:
Sends a file on Zoom to either an individual user in your contact list or a [channel](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/200912909-Getting-Started-With-Channels-Group-Messaging-) of which you are a member. 

 **Note:** 
* The base URL for this API is `https://file.zoom.us/v2/`. 
* The rate limit of this API is 20 requests per second per API or 2000 requests per second per IP address. 
* The caller must support HTTP 30x redirects. 
* All files are sent as common files except `png`,`jpg`,`jpeg` and `gif` 
* Zoom Cloud Storage will store the files sent through this API. If you do not use Zoom Cloud Storage, Zoom Cloud will temporarily store these files for 7 days. 
* The caller must retain the authorization header when redirected to a different hostname. 

For user-level apps, pass [the `me` value](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis#mekeyword) instead of the `userId` parameter. 

 For an [account-level OAuth app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/guides/getting-started/app-types/create-oauth-app), this API can only be used on behalf of a user who is assigned with a [role](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115001078646-Using-role-management) that has the **Edit** permission for **Chat Messages**. 

 

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `chat_message:write`,`chat_message:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `team_chat:write:message_files`,`team_chat:write:message_files:admin`

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user's ID.

files.description:
A list of the chat files to send, in binary format. 
* This field only supports one file. 
* You can only send a maximum of 16 megabytes for images and 20 megabytes for all other file types.

reply_main_message_id.description: The reply message's ID. This field only returns if the message is a reply message.

to_channel.description: The channel ID of the channel to which to send the chat file.

to_contact.description: The user ID or member ID of the contact to whom you want to send the chat file.

201.description:
**Status Code:** `201`   
 
File sent.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `5301`
Message sending failed. **Error Code:** `5402`
This only supports replies to a main message. **Error Code:** `124`
Invalid access token. **Error Code:** `300`
Maximum file size exceeded: ${maxSize}

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found **Error Code:** `1001`
User does not exist: $to_contact.
**Error Code:** `4130`
Channel does not exist: $to_channel.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

get.description:
Returns a chat message previously sent to a contact or a channel. For user-level apps, pass [the `me` value](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis#mekeyword) instead of the `userId` parameter.

You must provide one of the following query parameters:  
 
* `to_contact` — The email address of the Zoom contact to whom you sent the message.
* `to_channel` — The ID of the Zoom channel where you sent the message.



**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `chat_message:read`,`chat_message:read:admin`,`chat_message:write`,`chat_message:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `team_chat:read:user_message`,`team_chat:read:user_message:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: forwardId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the forwarded message.

200.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `200`
Message successfully returned.

bot_message.description: The chatbot's message in JSON format. For more information, see [Send, edit, and delete messages](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/team-chat-apps/send-edit-and-delete-messages/) in the Team Chat apps documentation.

date_time.description: The date and time when the message was sent.

start_position.description: The start position of the rich text in the message string.

end_position.description: The end position of the rich text in the message string.

format_type.description: The type of rich text format.

format_attr.description: The attribute values of a specific format type. FontSize: 's' for small, 'm' for medium, or 'l' for large font sizes. FontColor and BackgroundColor: only supports RGB values (e.g., 'FFC0CB'). LeftIndent: a positive pixel length. Paragraph: 'h1' for heading 1, 'h2' for heading 2, or 'h3' for heading 3. AddLink: must be a valid URL with an 'http' or 'https' prefix (e.g., 'https://example.com').

files.description: The information about the chat file.

file_name.description: The chat file's name and extension.

file_size.description: The chat file's size in bytes.

id.description: The unique identifier of the forwarded message.

message_type.description: The common type of messages that indicates which type of file to include: plain_text_message, jpg_image_file, audio_file, video_file, png_image_file, gif_file, giphy_file, code_snippet, file_and_text, or others.

emoji.description: The emoji's Unicode value in UTF-32 format.

user_ids.description: A list of user IDs from the same account that replied to this message with this emoji. User IDs of those who are not from the same account will be omitted from the list.

member_ids.description: A list of user member IDs that replied to this message with this emoji.

reply_main_message_timestamp.description: The timestamp when the main message in the thread was sent. This field only returns if the message is a reply message.

sender.description: The message sender's email address. If the sender does not belong to the same account as the current user or is not the current user's contact, this field is empty.

at_contact_member_id.description: The member ID of the contact. This field is returned if the value of the at_type field is set to 1.

at_type.description: The type of mention. 1: Contact. 2: Channel.

end_position.description: The end position of the mention in the message string.

start_position.description: The start position of the mention ('@') in the message string.

interactive_cards.description: The information about the chat interactive card.

card_id.description: The chat interactive card's unique ID.

card_json.description: The JSON string for the interactive card.

schema.description: The information about the chat message.

get.description:
Returns the bookmarks for a given channel, 1:1 conversation, or across all of the sessions 

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `chat_message:read`,`chat_message:write`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `team_chat:read:list_bookmarks`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `MEDIUM`

parameters.name: to_contact
parameters.description:
This field allows you to query by the email address, user ID, or member ID of a chat contact. The API only returns messages bookmarked in the 1:1 conversation between the user and the queried contact.

If `to_contact' and 'to_channel` values are not provided, bookmarks across all of the user's sessions will be returned.

parameters.name: to_channel
parameters.description:
This field allows you to query by the channel ID of a channel in which the user had chat conversations. The API only returns messages bookmarked by the user in the queried channel.

If `to_contact' and 'to_channel` values are not provided, bookmarks across all of the user's sessions will be returned.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of records to be returned with a single API call.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size.

200.description:
**HTTP Status Code:**`200`
List of bookmarked messages returned.

next_page_token.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

page_size.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

bookmarks.description: The information about the user's bookmarks.

channel_id.description: The channel ID of the chat session.

message_id.description: The message ID, which is the message's unique identifier. You can use the [**Get a message**](/docs/api/rest/reference/chat/methods/#operation/getChatMessage) API to fetch additional details about the message.

sender_user_id.description: The sender's user ID. It omits the user ID who is not from the same account.

is_sent_by_user.description: This field returns `true` if the user sends the bookmarked message.

reply_main_message_id.description: The main message's unique ID. The API only returns this value if the bookmarked message is a reply or thread message.

reply_main_message_timestamp.description: The main message's timestamp. The API only returns this value if the bookmarked message is a reply or thread message.

oneOf.description: The details of a message bookmarked in a channel.

peer_contact_name.description: The name of the peer contact of the conversation.

peer_contact_user_id.description: The user ID of the peer contact of the conversation. It omits the user ID who is not from the same account.

peer_contact_member_id.description: The member ID of the peer contact of the conversation.

message_id.description: The message ID, which is the message's unique identifier. You can use the [**Get a message**](/docs/api/rest/reference/chat/methods/#operation/getChatMessage) API to fetch additional details about the message.

is_sent_by_user.description: This field returns `true` if the user sends a bookmarked message.

reply_main_message_id.description: The main message's unique ID. The API only returns this value if the bookmarked message is a reply or thread message.

reply_main_message_timestamp.description: The main message's timestamp. The API only returns this value if the bookmarked message is a reply or thread message.

oneOf.description: The details of a message bookmarked in a 1:1 conversation.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the message.  You can retrieve the message ID using the [**List user's chat messages**](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/reference/chat/methods/#operation/getChannels) API.

action.description:
This field specifies an action for this request. The value can be one of the following:
 
`add_bookmark`: Add a new bookmark. 
`remove_bookmark`: Remove an existing bookmark.

to_channel.description:
The channel ID where the message was sent.
You must provide this parameter or the `to_contact` parameter in the API request. You can retrieve the channel ID using the [**List user's channels**](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/reference/chat/methods/#operation/getChannels) API.

to_contact.description:

You must provide either a `to_contact` or `to_channel` parameter in the API request.

end_position.description: The end position of the rich text.

format_type.description: The type of rich text format.

format_attr.description:
The attribute values of a specific `format_type`:

1.`FontSize`: `s` for small, `m` for medium, or `l` for large font sizes. 

2.`FontColor` and `BackgroundColor`: only supports RGB values. For example: `FFC0CB` 

3.`LeftIndent`: a positive pixel length.  

4.`Paragraph`: `h1` for heading 1, `h2` for heading 2, or `h3` for heading 3.

at_contact.description: The contact's user ID. This field will be empty if the user ID does not belong to the same account as the current user.

at_contact_member_id.description: The member ID of the contact. This field is returned if the value of `at_type` field is set to 1.

at_type.description:
The type of mention. `1`: Contact. 

* `2`: Channel.

end_position.description:
The end position of the mention.

Example message: "@Shrijana How are you?"
In this case, the end position of the mention "@Shrijana" is 8. Hence, the value of this field will be 8.

start_position.description:
The start position of the mention("@") in the message string. 

For example if you want to include the mention at the beginning of the message, the value for this field will be 0. 

Example message: "@Shrijana How are you?"

get.description:
Returns a list of chat messages and shared files between a user and an individual contact, or a chat channel. For user-level apps, pass [the `me` value](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/using-zoom-apis/#the-me-keyword) instead of the `userId` parameter.  

**Note:** For an [account-level OAuth app](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/create/), this API can only be used on behalf of a [user assigned to a role](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115001078646-Using-role-management) with the **Edit** permission for **Chat Messages**. 



**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `chat_message:read`,`chat_message:write`,`chat_message:read:admin`,`chat_message:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `team_chat:read:list_user_messages`,`team_chat:read:list_user_messages:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `MEDIUM`

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the user.

parameters.name: to_contact
parameters.description:
This field allows you to query by the email address, user ID, or member ID of a chat contact with whom the user communicated. The API only returns messages sent and received between the user and the queried contact. 

**Note:** 
* You must provide either the `to_contact` or the `to_channel` query parameter. 
* When you call the `search_key` and `search_type` query parameters, this query parameter is optional and **not** required.

parameters.name: to_channel
parameters.description:
This field allows you to query by the channel ID of a channel in which the user had chat conversations. The API only returns messages sent and received by the user in the queried channel. 

**Note:** 
* You must provide either the `to_contact` or the `to_channel` query parameter. 
* When you call the `search_key` and `search_type` query parameters, this query parameter is optional and **not** required.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The query date from which to retrieve the chat messages. This value defaults to the current date. 

 **Note:** If you do not provide the `date` or `from` query parameters, the API defaults to the `date` query parameter.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
The query start date in `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'` format.

 **Note:** If you provide both the `date` and `from` query parameters, the API uses the `date` value to query.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The query end date in `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'` format. This value defaults to the current date.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of records returned with a single API call.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: include_deleted_and_edited_message
parameters.description:
**Optional**   
 
This field sets the value of this field to `true` to include edited and deleted messages in the response.

parameters.name: search_type
parameters.description:
The type of search: 
* `message` — Search messages. 
* `file` — Search files. 

**Note:** 
* If you use this query parameter, you must also include a `search_key` query parameter value. 
* The `to_contact` and the `to_channel` query parameters are **not** required when you query this parameter. If you do not call them, the API returns **all** contact and channel messages that match the `search_type` query. 
* If you query this parameter, you **cannot** also query the `include_deleted_and_edited_message` parameter. This query parameter does not support the return of deleted or updated messages.

parameters.name: search_key
parameters.description:
The query string for messages or files, up to 256 characters. 

**Note:** 
* If you use this query parameter, you must also include a `search_type` query parameter value. 
* The `to_contact` and the `to_channel` query parameters are **not** required when you query this parameter. If you do not call them, the API returns **all** contact and channel messages that match the `search_key` query. 
* If you query this parameter, you **cannot** also query the `include_deleted_and_edited_message` parameter. This query parameter does not support the return of deleted or updated messages.

parameters.name: exclude_child_message
parameters.description: This parameter excludes returning all child messages in a chat. It leaves only the parent messages.

parameters.name: download_file_formats
parameters.description: This field returns the download URL in the specified format for different types of files. Currently, we only support the download URL in the .mp4 format for audio files. If this parameter is not specified, it returns the download URL of the file in its default format.

200.description:
**HTTP Status Code:**`200`  
 
The list of chat messages returned.

from.description: The queried start date. The API only returns this value if you call the `from` query parameter.

messages.description: The information about the received messages and files.

date_time.description: The date and time when the message was sent.

files.description: The information about all the chat files (if there are multiple files).

file_name.description: The chat file's name and file extension.

file_size.description: The chat file's size, in bytes.

2.`FontColor` and `BackgroundColor`: only supports RGB values. For example: `FFC0CB` 

3.`LeftIndent`: a positive pixel length.  

4.`Paragraph`: `h1` for heading 1, `h2` for heading 2, or `h3` for heading 3. 

5.`AddLink`: must be a valid URL with an `http` or `https` prefix. For example: `https://example.com`

member_id.description: The user member ID that reacted to this message with this emoji.

reply_main_message_id.description: The unique identifier of a reply. This field returns if the message is a reply message.

reply_main_message_timestamp.description: The timestamp of when the reply message was sent. This field returns if the message is a reply message.

sender.description: The message sender's email address. If the sender does not belong to the same account as the current user or is not the current user's contact, this field is empty.

status.description: This field indicates whether a message is an original message(unedited), an edited message, or a deleted message. This field only returns if you set the value of `for include_deleted_and_edited_message` query parameter to `true`.

at_contact.description: The contact's user ID. This field is empty if the contact does not belong to the same account as the current user.

The type of mention. `1`: Contact. 

* `2`: Channel.

interactive_cards.description: The information about the chat interactive card.

card_id.description: The chat interactive card's unique ID.

card_json.description: The JSON string for the interactive card.

next_page_token.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

page_size.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

to.description: The queried end date. The API only returns this value if you call the `to` query parameter.

post.description:
Sends chat messages to a user in your contact list or to a [channel](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/200912909-Getting-Started-With-Channels-Group-Messaging-) of which you are a member.  
For user-level apps, pass [the `me` value](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis#mekeyword) instead of the `userId` parameter.

- To send a message to a contact, provide the contact's email address in the `to_contact` field.  
- To send a message to a channel, provide the channel's ID in the `to_channel` parameter.



**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `chat_message:write`,`chat_message:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `team_chat:write:user_message`,`team_chat:write:user_message:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `MEDIUM`

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the user.

at_items.description: The [chat mentions](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360037567431-Using-chat-mentions-and-slash-commands) object. Use this object to include mentions in the message that will be sent to  a channel.

at_contact.description: This field is required if the value of `at_type` field is set to 1.

oneOf.description: The email address of the contact.
The member ID of the contact.

at_type.description:
The type of mention. You can use one of the following values:  
 
* `1`: Mention a contact. 

* `2`: Mention "all" to notify everyone in the channel.

rich_text.description: The [rich text formatting](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115004789183-Replying-to-and-managing-chat-messages) object. Use this object to include rich text in the message that will be sent. Use `\n` as newline char.

format_type.description:
The type of rich text. There is some special logic which is the same as on the Zoom client. 

1. `AddLink`'s position can not cross multi lines. 

2. A `BulletedList` will clear the formatting of a `NumberedList`, `Quote`, or `LeftIndent` after it. 

3. Likewise, a `NumberedList` will clear the formatting of a `BulletedList`, `Quote`, or `LeftIndent` after it. 

4. Only `AddLink`, `NumberedList` and `BulletedList` can apply to a message which already applied a `Quote`.  

5. A `Quote` will clear the formatting of all styles after it except `AddLink`, `NumberedList`, `BulletedList`, or `Italic`. 

6. An `AddLink` will clear the formatting of `BackgroundColor`, `FontColor`, or `Underline` after it.  

7. `BackgroundColor`, `FontColor` and `Underline` can not apply to a message which already applied `AddLink`. 

8. `BulletedList`, `NumberedList`, `LeftIndent`, `Paragraph`, and `Quote` will automatically expand to apply to the whole line.

format_attr.description:
This field is required if the value of the `format_type` field is listed below:

1.`FontSize` value: `s` for small, `m` for medium, or `l` for large font size. 

2.`FontColor` and `BackgroundColor` value: only supports RGB value. For example: `FFC0CB` 

3.`LeftIndent` value: a positive pixel length.  

4.`Paragraph` value: `h1` for Heading 1, `h2` for Heading 2, or `h3` for Heading 3. 

5.`AddLink` value: must be a valid URL, with an `http` or `https` prefix. For example: `https://example.com`

file_ids.description: A list of the file IDs to send. This field only accepts a maximum of six file IDs.

reply_main_message_id.description: The unique ID of the main message in the thread. This field is required if the message is a reply message.

to_channel.description: The channel ID of the channel where you would like to send a message.

to_contact.description: The email address, user ID, or member ID of the person you wish to send a message.

interactive_cards.description: A list of the interactive card to send. The app calling this API must be the app to which the card belongs, otherwise the card cannot be sent. This field only accepts a maximum of five interactive cards to send.

card_json.description: The JSON string for the interactive card. Only successfully created cards will be sent. Failure to create a card will result in message delivery failure.

scheduled_time.description: The scheduled time to send the message in yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z' format. It must be more than 30 minutes from now and within 180 days.

201.description:
**Status Code:** `201`  
 
Message sent.

id.description: The unique identifier of the message or draft. If the `scheduled_time` is not empty, then it's the draft ID.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `5301`
Message sending failed.

**Error Code:** `5402`
This only supports replies to a main message.

**Error Code:** `5403`
Account settings do not allow files to be sent.
**Error Code:** `300`
Invalid parameter: send_time. The time requirement is more than 30 minutes from now and within 180 days.
**Error Code:** `5405`
Failed to create interactive card.
**Error Code:** `5418`
The user can not chat with others.
**Error Code:** `5419`
Can not send message to an E2E channel.
**Error Code:** `5420`
Can not send message to an archived channel.
**Error Code:** `5421`
Can not send message to a blocked contact.

get.description:
Returns a chat message previously sent to a contact or a channel. For user-level apps, pass [the `me` value](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis#mekeyword) instead of the `userId` parameter.

You must provide one of the following query parameters:  
 
* `to_contact` — The email address of the Zoom contact to whom you sent the message.
* `to_channel` — The ID of the Zoom channel where you sent the message.



**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `chat_message:read`,`chat_message:read:admin`,`chat_message:write`,`chat_message:write:admin`

put.description:
Edits a chat message that you previously sent to either a contact or a channel in Zoom. 

It provides the ID of the message as the value of the `messageId` parameter. You can get the ID from the [List User's Chat Messages](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/reference/chat/methods/#operation/getChatMessages) API. Additionally, as a query parameter, you must provide either the contact's **email address** of the contact or the **Channel ID** of the channel where the message was sent.

For user-level apps, pass [the `me` value](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis#mekeyword) instead of the `userId` parameter.

**Note:** For an **account-level** [OAuth app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/guides/getting-started/app-types/create-oauth-app), you can only use this API on behalf of a user who is assigned with a [role](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115001078646-Using-role-management#:~:text=Each%20user%20in%20a%20Zoom,owner%2C%20administrator%2C%20or%20member.&text=Role%2Dbased%20access%20control%20enables,needs%20to%20view%20or%20edit.) that has the **Edit** permission for **Chat Messages**.



**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `chat_message:write`,`chat_message:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `team_chat:update:user_message`,`team_chat:update:user_message:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `MEDIUM`

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the user.

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the message.

to_channel.description: The channel ID where you sent the message. You must provide either this parameter or the `to_contact` parameter in the API request.

to_contact.description: The email address, user ID, or member ID of the contact to whom the message was sent. You must provide either this parameter or the `to_channel` parameter in the API request.

file_ids.description: A list of the file IDs to update. This field only accepts a maximum of six file IDs. If this field is empty, the files in the message will be cleared.

interactive_cards.description: A list of the interactive cards to update. The app calling this API must be the app to which the card belongs, otherwise the card cannot be created. This field only accepts a maximum of five interactive cards. If this field is empty, the interactive card in the message will be cleared.

items.description: The `card_id` and `card_json` are both optional fields. `card_id` takes precedence if both are provided. If it's a `card_json`, we will create a new interactive card, and the corresponding `card_id` will also change.

card_id.description: The chat interactive card's unique ID. This ID only supports the `card_id` from the original message and cannot be used across different messages.

card_json.description: The JSON string for the interactive card. Only successfully created cards will be sent. Failure to create a card will result in message delivery failure.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `200`
Only the sender of this message can make updates.

**Error Code:** `300`
Message does not exist: $messageId.
Must provide either contact or channel parameter.

**Error Code:** `300`
A plain text message that is sent without any files is not allowed to update with the file.
**Error Code:** `5404`
File does not exist: $file_ids.
**Error Code:** `5045`
Failed to create interactive card.
**Error Code:** `5046`
Interactive Cards does not exist: `$interactive_cards.card_id`.

patch.description:
Adds or removes an emoji to a chat message.

For an **account-level** [OAuth app](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/guides/getting-started/app-types/create-oauth-app), this API can only be used on behalf of a user who is assigned with a [role](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115001078646-Using-role-management#:~:text=Each%20user%20in%20a%20Zoom,owner%2C%20administrator%2C%20or%20member.&text=Role%2Dbased%20access%20control%20enables,needs%20to%20view%20or%20edit.) that has the **Edit** permission for **Chat Messages**.



**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `chat_message:write`,`chat_message:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `team_chat:update:message_emoji`,`team_chat:update:message_emoji:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `MEDIUM`

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user's unique ID.

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: The message's unique ID.

action.description:
The action to perform with the message:
* `add` — Add an emoji reaction.
* `remove` — Remove an emoji reaction.

emoji.description: The emoji's unicode value, in `UTF-32` format. For more information, read the [Emojipedia](https://emojipedia.org/emoji-modifier-sequence/) documentation.

to_channel.description:
The channel's ID where you sent the message. You must provide either the `to_contact` or the `to_channel` parameter in the API request.

To get a channel's ID, use the [**List user's channels**](/docs/api-reference/chat/methods#operation/getChannels) API.

to_contact.description: The email address or user ID or member ID of the contact to whom the message was sent. You must provide either the `to_contact` or the `to_channel` parameter in the API request. To get a channel's ID, use the [**List user's channels**](/docs/api-reference/chat/methods#operation/getChannels) API.

custom_emoji.description: If set to true, you will need to provide the `custom_emoji_id` field.

custom_emoji_id.description:
The custom emoji file's ID where you react the message. 

To get a custom emoji ID, use the [**List custom emojis**](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/team-chat/#tag/chat-emoji/GET/chat/emoji) API.

get.description:
Retrieves all messages under a thread. For user-level apps, pass the `me` value instead of the `userId` parameter.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `chat_message:read`,`chat_message:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `team_chat:read:thread_message`,`team_chat:read:thread_message:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `MEDIUM`

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the user.

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the main message to retrieve.

parameters.name: to_channel
parameters.description: The channel ID where you want to query thread messages. You must provide this parameter or the `to_contact` parameter.

parameters.name: to_contact
parameters.description: The user ID, member ID, or email address of a chat contact to whom the reminders you want to query. You must provide this parameter or the `to_channel` parameter.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The start time of the reply. The format is `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'`.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The end time of the reply. The format is `yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'`. If this value is not passed, it is the current time by default.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: This field limits the number of replies returned. The maximum value is 100.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: This field can be designated as `desc` or `asc`, and is sorted by the reply time. If this parameter is `desc`, the latest reply message is at the top of the results.

parameters.name: need_main_message
parameters.description: Whether the main message is needed. This parameter controls whether the content of the main message is included in the returned result. If false is passed, the messages array will only contain replies.

parameters.name: need_emoji
parameters.description: Whether the emoji is needed.

parameters.name: need_attachment
parameters.description: Whether the attachments are needed.

parameters.name: need_rich_text
parameters.description: Whether rich text is needed.

parameters.name: need_at_items
parameters.description: Whether the @(at) items are needed.

200.description: The results of the retrieved information.

msg_id.description: The unique ID of the message.

is_reply.description: This message is a main message or a reply.

emoji_id.description: The emoji's unicode value in UTF-32 format.

is_sender.description: Whether the user has sent this emoji.

last_reply_time.description: The last reply's timestamp. This field only exists when the message is a main message.

is_followed.description: Whether the user has followed this main message. This field only exists when the message is a main message

file_name.description: The file's name and file extension.

sender_user_id.description: The message sender's user ID. This field is empty if the sender does not belong to the same account as the current user or is not the current user's contact.

sender_email.description: The message sender's email address. This field is empty if the sender does not belong to the same account as the current user or is not the current user's contact.

start_position.description: The start position of the rich text in the message string.

end_position.description: The end position of the rich text.

format_type.description: The type of rich text format.

format_attr.description:
The attribute values of a specific `format_type`:

1.`FontSize`: `s` for small, `m` for medium, or `l` for large font sizes. 

2.`FontColor` and `BackgroundColor`: only supports RGB values. For example: `FFC0CB` 

3.`LeftIndent`: a positive pixel length.  

4.`Paragraph`: `h1` for heading 1, `h2` for heading 2, or `h3` for heading 3. 

5.`AddLink`: must be a valid URL with an `http` or `https` prefix. For example: `https://example.com`

at_contact.description: The contact's user ID. This field is empty if the contact does not belong to the same account as the current user.

at_type.description:
The type of mention. `1`: Contact. 

* `2`: Channel.

bot_message.description: The chatbot's message in JSON format. For more information, see [Send, edit, and delete messages](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/team-chat-apps/send-edit-and-delete-messages/) in the *Team Chat apps* documentation.

interactive_cards.description: The information about the chat interactive card.

card_id.description: The chat interactive card's unique ID.

card_json.description: The JSON string for the interactive card.

message_type.description:
The common type of messages that indicates which type of file to include. 
 plain_text_message. 
 jpg_image_file. 
 audio_file. 
 video_file. 
 png_image_file. 
 gif_file. 
 giphy_file. 
 code_snippet. 
 file_and_text. 
 others.

**Error Code:** `4232`
The `sort` can only be passed `asc` or `desc`.
**Error Code:** `4233`
The `from` cannot be blank.
**Error Code:** `4234`
The `to_channel` cannot be blank.

reply_main_message_timestamp.description: The time (epoch time in milliseconds) at which the first or main message in the thread was originally sent. This field will be used to map when sending a parent message and thread message at the same API call.

post.description:
Migrates a chat channel.

**Note**: The use of this endpoint is **locked**.  We make it available upon request on a case by case basis. To unlock this endpoint, contact [Zoom Support](https://support.zoom.com/hc/en/contact?id=contact_us). 

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `chat_migration:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `team_chat:write:migrate_a_chat_channel:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `MEDIUM`

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The user ID or member ID of the owner of the chat channel being migrated.

members.description:
The list of members of the channel being migrated. 
The maximum number of members is 20. 
The channel owner should not be included.

identifier.description: The user ID, member ID, or email of the channel member.

role.description: The role of the channel member: `admin` or `member`.

type.description:
The type of the channel being migrated. 

2: Private channel. Members belong to a Zoom account. Members in this channel should be invited and be from the same organization. 
3: Public channel. Anyone can search for this channel and join the channel. 
4: Group chat. An instant channel that can be created by adding members to a new chat.

name.description: The name of the channel being migrated.

created_time.description: The creation date and time of the migrated channel.

**Status Code**: `201` **Created**  
 The chat channel has been successfully migrated.

**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `5301`
Request to migrate a channel failed.

post.description:
Performs operations on migrated 1:1 conversations or channels. For now, the only supported operation is to star 1:1 conversations or channels.

**Note**: By default, the use of this endpoint is **locked**. We make it available upon request on a case by case basis. To unlock this endpoint, contact [Zoom Support](https://support.zoom.com/hc/en/contact?id=contact_us). 

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `chat_migration:write:admin`

method.description:

* `channel` — Perform operations on a channel. When using `channel`, the `target_id` refers to chat channel's ID. 
* `contact` — Perform operations on a contact. When using `contact`, the `target_id` refers to the contact user's ID, member ID or email.

post.description:
Creates a reminder for a person or a chat channel. 

You must provide one of the following query parameters:
`to_contact` — The email address of the Zoom contact to whom you want to set the reminder.
`to_channel` — The ID of the Zoom channel where you set the reminder.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `chat_message:write`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `team_chat:write:reminder`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the message.

to_contact.description: The email address of the Zoom contact to whom you set the reminder.

to_channel.description: The ID of the Zoom channel where you set the reminder.

remind_time.description:
The message reminder time in yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z' format to remind the user. It should be greater than the current time, and no later than 90 days later.

Only one parameter needs to be passed in `remind_time` and `delay_seconds`.

delay_seconds.description:
This field enables you to delay a notification reminder by seconds. 
 
 For example, if the user calls this API to add a reminder at 2024-01-15T09:28:30Z , and the `delay_seconds` is set as 300 seconds, then the user will receive the notification at 2024-01-15T09:33:30Z.

Only one parameter needs to be passed in `remind_time` and `delay_seconds`.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `4100`
The provided `to_contact` or `to_channel` parameter is invalid.
**Error Code:** `4101`
`delay_seconds` can only be between 300 and 7776000.
**Error Code:** `4102`
One parameter from `to_contact` and `to_channel` must be passed.
**Error Code:** `4103`
One parameter from `remind_time` and `delay_seconds` must be passed.
**Error Code:** `4104`
`messageId` cannot be blank.
**Error Code:** `4105`
`remind_time` should be greater than the current time, and the latest is 90 days later.
**Error Code:** `4106`
The `remind_time` must follow the format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'.

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found **Error Code:** `4200`
Message does not exist: $messageId.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

patch.summary: Star or unstar a channel or contact user
patch.description:
Stars or unstars a contact or channel user. For user-level apps, pass [the `me` value](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis#mekeyword) instead of the `userId` parameter.



**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `chat_event:write:admin`,`chat_event:write`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `team_chat:update:chat_control`,`team_chat:update:chat_control:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `MEDIUM`

parameters.description: The user's ID.

method.description:
The method to perform: 
* `star` — Star the contact or channel. 
* `unstar` — Unstar the contact or channel.

target_id.description: The chat channel's ID, the contact user's ID, or the channel member's member ID.

target_type.description:
The type of operation. 
* `channel` — Perform operations on a channel. When using `channel`, the `target_id` refers to chat channel's ID. 
* `contact` — Perform operations on a contact. When using `contact`, the `target_id` refers to the contact user's ID or the contact user's member ID.
